intro: Euphrasia andicola, commonly known as the Andean eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its name derives from the Greek word "euphrasion," meaning cheerful, reflecting its bright appearance. Euphrasia andicola is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
